alert.note: Alert for Clark; Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 05 at 1:44PM CST until March 06 at 3:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Wet Accumulating Snow Tonight... .Rain or snow will develop late this afternoon or evening, transitioning to snow, with the highest impact period expected from this evening into early Monday morning. The highest totals are still expected near and north of Interstate 94 with lighter totals south into the Interstate 90 corridor where more rain or mixed precipitation may occur. Rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour will be possible for a few hours this evening, especially north of Interstate 94, resulting in quick accumulations on roads and slick, difficult travel. Light mixed precipitation could persist into Monday along with gusty winds. Although most of the accumulating snow will be done by sunrise, some travel impacts for the Monday morning commute are possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor and Clark Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
